title: Introduction to Data Science
description: Basic concepts and overview of data science

questions.question: What is data science?
options: Extracting insights from data using scientific methods
questions.correct_answer: Extracting insights from data using scientific methods
questions.explanation: Data science combines statistics, programming, and domain expertise to extract insights from data.

questions.question: What is the most important programming language for data science?
questions.correct_answer: Python
questions.explanation: Python is the most popular language for data science due to its simplicity and extensive libraries.

questions.question: What is machine learning?
options: A subset of AI that learns from data
questions.correct_answer: A subset of AI that learns from data
questions.explanation: Machine learning is a method of data analysis that automates analytical model building.

questions.question: What is the difference between AI and machine learning?
options: AI is broader, ML is a subset of AI
ML is broader, AI is a subset of ML
AI is for robots, ML is for data
questions.correct_answer: AI is broader, ML is a subset of AI
questions.explanation: Artificial Intelligence encompasses machine learning and other approaches to create intelligent systems.

questions.question: What is big data?
options: Data that is too large or complex for traditional tools
questions.correct_answer: Data that is too large or complex for traditional tools
questions.explanation: Big data refers to datasets that are too large or complex to be processed by traditional methods.

questions.question: What is NumPy used for?
questions.correct_answer: Numerical computing and arrays
questions.explanation: NumPy provides support for large, multi-dimensional arrays and mathematical functions.

questions.question: What is pandas used for?
questions.correct_answer: Data manipulation and analysis
questions.explanation: Pandas provides data structures and operations for working with structured data.

questions.question: What is matplotlib used for?
options: Creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations
questions.correct_answer: Creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations
questions.explanation: Matplotlib is a comprehensive library for creating visualizations in Python.

questions.question: What is scikit-learn?
options: A machine learning library for Python
questions.correct_answer: A machine learning library for Python
questions.explanation: Scikit-learn provides simple and efficient tools for predictive data analysis.

questions.question: What is Jupyter Notebook?
questions.correct_answer: An interactive computing environment
questions.explanation: Jupyter Notebook allows creating and sharing documents with live code, equations, and visualizations.

title: Data Collection and Cleaning
description: Gathering and preparing data for analysis

questions.question: What is data cleaning?
options: Removing errors and inconsistencies from data
questions.correct_answer: Removing errors and inconsistencies from data
questions.explanation: Data cleaning involves identifying and correcting errors in datasets.

questions.question: What is ETL?
questions.correct_answer: Extract, Transform, Load
questions.explanation: ETL is a process that extracts data from sources, transforms it, and loads it into a destination.

questions.question: What are missing values in data?
options: Data points that are not available
questions.correct_answer: Data points that are not available
questions.explanation: Missing values occur when no data value is stored for a variable in an observation.

questions.question: What is data normalization?
options: Scaling data to a standard range
questions.correct_answer: Scaling data to a standard range
questions.explanation: Data normalization scales numeric variables to a standard range, usually 0 to 1.

questions.question: What is feature engineering?
options: Creating new features from existing data
questions.correct_answer: Creating new features from existing data
questions.explanation: Feature engineering involves creating new input features from existing ones to improve model performance.

questions.question: What is EDA?
questions.correct_answer: Exploratory Data Analysis
questions.explanation: EDA is an approach to analyzing datasets to summarize their main characteristics.

questions.question: What is a histogram used for?
options: Showing the distribution of a single variable
questions.correct_answer: Showing the distribution of a single variable
questions.explanation: Histograms display the frequency distribution of a continuous variable.

questions.question: What is a scatter plot used for?
options: Showing the relationship between two continuous variables
questions.correct_answer: Showing the relationship between two continuous variables
questions.explanation: Scatter plots display values for two variables as points on a Cartesian plane.

questions.question: What is correlation?
options: A statistical measure of the relationship between two variables
questions.correct_answer: A statistical measure of the relationship between two variables
questions.explanation: Correlation measures how closely two variables move together.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a box plot?
options: To show the distribution and outliers of data
questions.correct_answer: To show the distribution and outliers of data
questions.explanation: Box plots display the median, quartiles, and potential outliers of a dataset.

title: Statistics for Data Science
description: Statistical concepts essential for data science

questions.question: What is the mean?
options: The average of a set of numbers
The middle value in a sorted list
The difference between max and min
questions.correct_answer: The average of a set of numbers
questions.explanation: The mean is calculated by summing all values and dividing by the number of values.

questions.question: What is standard deviation?
options: A measure of the spread of data around the mean
questions.correct_answer: All of the above
questions.explanation: Standard deviation measures data variability and is the square root of variance.

questions.question: What is a normal distribution?
questions.correct_answer: A bell-shaped probability distribution
questions.explanation: The normal distribution is symmetric around the mean with most values near the center.

questions.question: What is hypothesis testing?
options: A method to test claims about populations using sample data
questions.correct_answer: A method to test claims about populations using sample data
questions.explanation: Hypothesis testing uses statistical methods to determine if claims about data are likely true.

questions.question: What is p-value?
options: The probability of observing the data if the null hypothesis is true
The probability of the alternative hypothesis
questions.correct_answer: The probability of observing the data if the null hypothesis is true
questions.explanation: A low p-value indicates strong evidence against the null hypothesis.

questions.question: What is supervised learning?
questions.correct_answer: Learning from labeled training data
questions.explanation: Supervised learning uses input-output pairs to learn a mapping function.

questions.question: What is regression?
questions.correct_answer: Predicting continuous values
questions.explanation: Regression predicts continuous numerical values based on input features.

questions.question: What is classification?
questions.correct_answer: Predicting discrete categories
questions.explanation: Classification assigns input data to predefined categories.

questions.question: What is overfitting?
options: Model performs well on training data but poorly on new data
Model performs poorly on training data
questions.correct_answer: Model performs well on training data but poorly on new data
questions.explanation: Overfitting occurs when a model learns noise in the training data instead of the underlying pattern.

questions.question: What is cross-validation?
options: A technique to assess model performance
questions.correct_answer: A technique to assess model performance
questions.explanation: Cross-validation splits data into training and testing sets multiple times to evaluate model performance.

questions.question: What is unsupervised learning?
questions.correct_answer: Learning from unlabeled data
questions.explanation: Unsupervised learning finds patterns in data without labeled examples.

questions.question: What is clustering?
questions.correct_answer: Grouping similar data points together
questions.explanation: Clustering algorithms group data points based on similarity measures.

questions.question: What is K-means clustering?
questions.correct_answer: A centroid-based clustering algorithm
questions.explanation: K-means partitions data into k clusters, each represented by a centroid.

questions.question: What is PCA?
options: Principal Component Analysis for dimensionality reduction
questions.correct_answer: Principal Component Analysis for dimensionality reduction
questions.explanation: PCA reduces the dimensionality of data while preserving variance.

questions.question: What is anomaly detection?
options: Finding data points that deviate significantly from normal behavior
questions.correct_answer: Finding data points that deviate significantly from normal behavior
questions.explanation: Anomaly detection identifies outliers or unusual observations in data.

title: Deep Learning
description: Neural networks and deep learning concepts

questions.question: What is deep learning?
options: A subset of machine learning using neural networks with multiple layers
questions.correct_answer: A subset of machine learning using neural networks with multiple layers
questions.explanation: Deep learning uses artificial neural networks with multiple hidden layers.

questions.question: What is a neural network?
options: A computing system inspired by biological neural networks
questions.correct_answer: A computing system inspired by biological neural networks
questions.explanation: Neural networks are composed of interconnected nodes that process and transmit information.

questions.question: What is backpropagation?
options: An algorithm for training neural networks
questions.correct_answer: An algorithm for training neural networks
questions.explanation: Backpropagation calculates gradients to update neural network weights.

questions.question: What is TensorFlow?
questions.correct_answer: An open-source machine learning framework
questions.explanation: TensorFlow is a framework for building and training machine learning models.

questions.question: What is PyTorch?
questions.correct_answer: An open-source machine learning library
questions.explanation: PyTorch is a Python-based scientific computing package for deep learning.

title: Data Science Ethics and Best Practices

questions.question: What is data privacy?
options: Protecting personal information from unauthorized access
questions.correct_answer: All of the above
questions.explanation: Data privacy involves protecting individuals' personal information and ensuring ethical use.

questions.question: What is bias in machine learning?
options: Systematic errors that can disadvantage certain groups
questions.correct_answer: Systematic errors that can disadvantage certain groups
questions.explanation: Bias occurs when a model produces systematically prejudiced results due to flawed assumptions.

questions.question: What is GDPR?
questions.correct_answer: General Data Protection Regulation
questions.explanation: GDPR is a regulation for data protection and privacy in the European Union.

questions.question: What is reproducible research?
options: Research that can be replicated by others
questions.correct_answer: Research that can be replicated by others
questions.explanation: Reproducible research allows others to verify and build upon findings.

questions.question: What is data governance?
options: Managing the availability, usability, integrity, and security of data
questions.correct_answer: Managing the availability, usability, integrity, and security of data
questions.explanation: Data governance establishes processes and responsibilities for data management.

title: Data Science in Production
description: Deploying and maintaining data science models

questions.question: What is model deployment?
options: Making a trained model available for use in production
questions.correct_answer: Making a trained model available for use in production
questions.explanation: Model deployment involves integrating a trained model into an application or service.

questions.question: What is MLOps?
questions.correct_answer: Machine Learning Operations
questions.explanation: MLOps applies DevOps principles to machine learning model development and deployment.

questions.question: What is model monitoring?
options: Tracking model performance and behavior in production
questions.correct_answer: Tracking model performance and behavior in production
questions.explanation: Model monitoring ensures models continue to perform well after deployment.

questions.question: What is A/B testing?
options: Comparing two versions of a model or feature
questions.correct_answer: Comparing two versions of a model or feature
questions.explanation: A/B testing compares two variants to determine which performs better.

questions.question: What is model retraining?
options: Updating a model with new data to maintain performance
questions.correct_answer: Updating a model with new data to maintain performance
questions.explanation: Model retraining updates existing models with new data to adapt to changing patterns.
